poem:
Diaspora Beauty

Bronzer like whispers,  
blush thick as memory,  
eyes adorned, lashes—false,  
but who can say  
what is real?

Lips plump as longing,  
echoes of Anatolia,  
bridging continents—  
a face of many lands,  
truth in painted hues.

The mirror calls softly  
to a world apart,  
beauty crafted,  
yet heart-owned.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Proxy war’ – Turkish TikTok makeup row exposes tensions with German diaspora It all began when Meri, a TikTok influencer from Turkey, mocked the makeup of Turkish women living in Germany. They were, she claimed, instantly recognisable by their bronzer, thick blush, false eyelashes and plumped lips. And the look favoured by the diaspora, she added, waspishly, had “nothing to do with how real Turkish women look”. Reaction from the diaspora was swift and stinging.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘Proxy war’ – Turkish TikTok makeup row exposes tensions with German diaspora It all began when Meri, a TikTok influencer from Turkey, mocked the makeup of Turkish women living in Germany. They were, she claimed, instantly recognisable by their bronzer, thick blush, false eyelashes and plumped lips. And the look favoured by the diaspora, she added, waspishly, had “nothing to do with how real Turkish women look”. Reaction from the diaspora was swift and stinging.
